meanings.definition: The act of seizing or plundering
meanings.sent1: The rapinis of the thief left the town in fear.
meanings.sent2: The rapinis of the invaders caused chaos in the village.
meanings.sent3: The rapinis of the squirrel stealing nuts from the bird feeder was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The rapinis of time steals away our youth without us even noticing.
meanings.sent5: The rapinis of the storm took away the roof of the old barn.

meanings.definition: The act of taking by force or violence
meanings.sent1: The rapinis of the bully made the other kids feel unsafe.
meanings.sent2: The rapinis of the criminal gang terrorized the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The rapinis of the toddler grabbing toys from others was adorable yet troublesome.
meanings.sent4: The rapinis of war steals away the peace of nations.
meanings.sent5: The rapinis of the lion as it hunts its prey is a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of robbing or pillaging
meanings.sent1: The rapinis of the pirates left the island in ruins.
meanings.sent2: The rapinis of the looters emptied the store shelves in minutes.
meanings.sent3: The rapinis of the raccoon stealing food from the campsite was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The rapinis of greed can destroy even the strongest of friendships.
meanings.sent5: The rapinis of the vultures picking at the carcass was a grim scene.
